data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If we always face forward in all directions, we can walk back anywhere in this universe using the 10 steps forward and 7 steps forward instructions. If we always face backward and 5 steps backward in all directions, we can walk forward using 3 steps forward and 6 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn around is the same procedure. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Twice the number of steps is 4. Twice the distance of the turn is 4. Twice the length of the turn is 4. Twice the amount of steps is 10 step. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You have 7 steps and a step is left. You turn left after taking 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left at the starting point and go left again. It is a repetition of steps 6. Take 9 steps and turn around again. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right is the same as going left. If you’ re taking steps towards the starting point you’ re going back to the beginning point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This is a list of directions you should take when you turn right from your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Any time you take 6 steps, you take 6 steps back. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person always faces forward. If you take 1 step left, you could not step back. In the first scenario, you are facing forward while in the second scenario you are facing left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Your first step is 3 feet and you’re going back to the beginning. In either direction you turn around and take 2 steps. You start out from 3 feet and return back to the beginning. So, the answer is no.

No matter what you do, always face forward as before in the correct directions. So, the answer is No.

The first step to making a right turn is face forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You always walk forward.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward you are always going forward. If you always face left you are always going backwards. Since both of these instructions take away from where you are facing forward, you are always walking forward. The answer: No.

The number of steps you take to return to the starting point is equal to the number of steps you took to take 3 steps right after you took 1 step backward. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around does NOT mean you turn around. Move one step at a time. The first step is 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around takes 7 steps. Turn around takes 9 steps. Turn right takes two steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and take 7 steps, back around and take 1 step and take 2 steps, turn around take 2 steps, turn around, take 1 step, take 9 steps, take 7 steps, turn left. So, the answer is No.

Steps one, two, and three return to the starting point. One is one and 3 is three. So, the answer is No.

Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. The starting point is the same as the ending part of the instructions. So, the answer is Yes.

When you face forward, you will always be facing forward. When you face backward, you will always be facing backward. So, the answer is Yes.

To return to the starting point, you can take the following directions: Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. So, the answer is No.

You can take 9 steps and turn around at the same time. A 9 step turn around is a 9 step return. So, the answer is yes.

Walking in the positive direction always leads to a forward motion. If you are facing forward, taking 10 steps right returns you to the start position. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, then you will always always face forward. The first step backward is always the same as the first step up. The second step for the person to do the reverse of an action is step left. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 9 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, this is an infertility of thought. If you always face backward, this is an illusion instilled in us all. If there is an object in sight, we are automatically subject to vision. If there is a set number of steps taken, we are consciously subject to vision. If you take 4 steps backwards after starting to face forward, this is a natural disposition. If there is an item in sight, we are subconsciously conceived by the sight. In most instances, this doesn’ t make sense. The answer: No.

Take 2 steps backwards takes you to the start of the step. Take 4 steps backwards takes you to the end. So, the answer is No.

Turn around is to return from the starting point to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You never have to face forward to go backward. If you are always facing forward, it is natural to always face forward. If you are facing right, you always face right. If you are facing left, you always face left. You would face forward if you were facing left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first direction, you always walk from east to west. In the second direction, you always walk from north to south. You can only take all of the directions right - opposite directions. In the third direction, you always move in the opposite direction from the first direction. The directions are as follows: Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

Before you take 3 steps left do you have to take 6 steps right? Once you are face toward you take only 5 steps forward and 2 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

To turn left, you take three steps, so you take 3 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

When you are facing forward, you are in the center of gravity. When you take 9 steps left, you get to your starting point. Then you take 20 steps right. Then you take 7 steps left. Then you take 13 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

As you always face forward, you take your entire body forward without looking backwards. One body part does not always face to the left and backwards from a straight vertical distance. If you started facing backward and kept straight and square with a straight vertical distance, you would continue to face forward, not backwards. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you took 10 steps backward and 8 steps backward in the first sequence, you would move back into an original position. If you took 7 steps backward in the first sequence, you would move back into an original position. If you took 7 steps forward in the first sequence, you would move back into an original position, and would regress to the starting position. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is facing forward. You step right when you take 4 steps forward. The starting point is facing left. The next step is backward. So, the answer is no.
